title: Create CI quality workflow
description:
Create .github/workflows/ci.yml for continuous integration with test, lint, and format jobs.

WHY: Provide automated feedback to contributors within 5 minutes and ensure code quality.

WHAT: Create CI workflow with test, lint, and format checks using GitHub Actions.
design:
Create .github/workflows/ci.yml with three jobs:
1. test: go test, coverage upload to Codecov
2. lint: golangci-lint with latest version
3. format: gofmt check

Use Go 1.24 (upgraded from 1.21). Use actions/checkout@v4, actions/setup-go@v5, codecov/codecov-action@v4, golangci/golangci-lint-action@v6.

Reference: quickstart.md Step 3, contracts/ci-cd-contract.md
acceptance_criteria:
- .github/workflows/ci.yml exists and is valid YAML
- Workflow runs on push to main and pull requests
- All three jobs (test, lint, format) pass on main branch
- Go version set to 1.24
- Coverage uploads to Codecov successfully

title: Phase 2: US1 - License Compliance
description:
Open Source License Compliance (P1)

WHY THIS PRIORITY: Without proper licensing, the project cannot be effectively open-sourced or used by others, creating legal risk and limiting community adoption.

INDEPENDENT TEST: Review presence and completeness of required legal files (LICENSE, NOTICE, etc.) and verify they contain appropriate content.

Creates:
- NOTICE file for third-party attributions
- GOVERNANCE.md for project decision-making
- Verification of existing legal files (LICENSE, CODE_OF_CONDUCT, SECURITY, CONTRIBUTING)

title: Phase 3: US4 - Release and Distribution

INDEPENDENT TEST: Install the project using Homebrew and verify installation works correctly.

Content should match:
- Existing README structure
- quickstart.md Prerequisites section

Update if gaps found.
acceptance_criteria:
- README has installation instructions for Homebrew
- README has build-from-source instructions
- Prerequisites documented (Go 1.24+)
- Basic usage example present
- Links to specledger.io/docs and CONTRIBUTING.md

title: Create documentation deployment workflow
description:
Create GitHub Actions workflow to deploy documentation to specledger.io/docs.

design:

title: Test release process dry-run
description:
Test the release process using GoReleaser dry-run mode.

WHY: Validate release automation works correctly before attempting an actual release.

WHAT: Create test tag and run GoReleaser in dry-run mode to verify artifact generation.
design:
Test release process:
1. Create test tag: git tag -a v0.0.0-test -m 'Test release'
2. Run: goreleaser release --clean --skip-publish --skip-sign
3. Verify artifacts in dist/
4. Clean up: git tag -d v0.0.0-test

Reference: quickstart.md 'Testing the Release Process' section
acceptance_criteria:
- Test tag created successfully
- GoReleaser dry-run completes without errors
- dist/ contains binaries for all platforms
- checksums.txt generated
- Test tag cleaned up after verification

title: Verify local quality tools
description:
Verify local development environment has all quality tools configured.

WHY: Enable contributors to run quality checks locally before submitting.

WHAT: Ensure golangci-lint is available and configured, and make test targets work.
design:
Verify local tooling:
1. Check golangci-lint is installed
2. Run 'golangci-lint run' - should pass with .golangci.yml config
3. Run 'make test' - should execute tests
4. Run 'make test-coverage' - should generate coverage
5. Run 'gofmt -l .' - should show no unformatted files

Reference: quickstart.md Verification section
acceptance_criteria:
- golangci-lint installed and runs successfully
- 'make test' passes without errors
- 'make test-coverage' generates coverage.out
- 'gofmt -l .' shows no output (all files formatted)
- Local results match CI expectations
